title: roman_empire
body:
The [b]Roman Empire[/b] (Latin: [i]Imperium Rōmānum[/i]) was the post-Republican period of ancient Rome. As a polity, it included large territorial holdings around the Mediterranean Sea in Europe, North Africa, and Western Asia, ruled by emperors with centralized authority in the namesake capital of [[Rome (city)|]], now in modern [[Italy]].

From the accession of Caesar Augustus as the first Roman emperor to the military anarchy of the 3rd century, it was a principate with Italy as the metropole of its provinces and the city of Rome as its sole capital. 

Later, the Empire was ruled by multiple emperors who shared control over the Western Roman Empire and the Eastern Roman Empire. 

[[Rome (city)|]] remained the nominal capital of both parts until AD 476 when the imperial insignia were sent to Constantinople following the capture of the Western capital of Ravenna by the Germanic barbarians under Odoacer and the subsequent deposition of Romulus Augustulus. 

The adoption of Christianity as the state church of the Roman Empire in AD 380 and the fall of the Western Roman Empire to [[germany|Germanic]] kings conventionally marks the end of classical antiquity and the beginning of [[medieval|the Middle Ages]]. 

h4. See also
* [[Byzantine Empire]] - the eastern half of the Roman Empire which survived until 1453
* [[Legionnaire]]
* [[Gladiator]]
* [[Holy Roman Empire]] - [[germany|Germanic]] successor of the old Roman Empire during the [[medieval]] period

title: restaurant
body:
An establishment where people can come in and order a meal of their choice off a menu, then a [[waiter]] or [[waitress]] sends the order to the [[kitchen]] where a [[chef]] and his/her team prepare said meal. The server then returns to the table with the dish, and then the customer pays for it after finishing. This is a very popular business because most people do not have the time to make meals on their own, or don't do it as well as the restaurant does.

Restaurants exist for all three different meals through the day - [[breakfast]], [[lunch]] and [[dinner]] - and for any type of palate, whether it's American, Japanese, Chinese, Mediterranean and so on. There are also late night and 24/7 places for those who work during the night.

body:

Living things being the most common since humanoids, plants and animals show their age, while most nonliving things stay the same; however, decay, dust and rust can be used as visual indicators. Opposite may apply if area has been cleaned instead.

The simple labeling of "Before" and "After" does not have to be illustrated in the artwork for this tag to apply.

title: ludwig_van_beethoven
body:
Famous [[germany|German]] composer and pianist who lived from a bit before December 17th 1770 to March 26th 1827.
He is one of the most revered figures in the history of Western music; his works rank among the most performed of the classical music repertoire and span the transition from the Classical period to the Romantic era in classical music.

title: dune_(1984_movie)
body:
A [[1984 (year)|]] movie adaption of the 1965 [[science fiction]] novel [[Dune (series)|]] by Frank Herbert, directed by [[David Lynch]].

Its reception was quite bad, and remains somewhat controversial due to it being regarded as sloppy and an overall poor adaptation of its source material, and the fact that significant creative liberties were taken by Lynch. Regardless, the film is considered a cult classic having developed a die-hard following of fans.

title: eraserhead
body: Eraserhead is a 1977 American independent surrealist body horror film written, directed, produced, and edited by [[David Lynch]]. Lynch also created its score and sound design, which included pieces by a variety of other musicians. Shot in black and white, it was Lynch's first feature-length effort following several short films. Starring Jack Nance, Charlotte Stewart, Jeanne Bates, Judith Anna Roberts, Laurel Near, and Jack Fisk, it tells the story of a man (Nance) who is left to care for his grossly deformed child in a desolate industrial landscape.

title: fate/strange_fake
body:
A light novel and manga series set in the [[Fate (series)|Fate universe]], written by [[Narita Ryohgo (mangaka)|]] and illustrated by [[Morii Shizuki]].

Originally an approved [[Fate/stay night]] fanfiction intended to be the introduction for a role playing style game by [[Narita Ryohgo (mangaka)|]]. Initially released as ''Fake/states night'' for a Type-MOON [[April Fools]] Day joke, then later rereleased in the form of a novel included as an extra with the magazine Type-MOON Ace 2. Eventually got an official light novel series and manga adaptation.

The plot centers around a Grail War faultily copied from the Third Holy Grail War in Fuyuki. The story is set in Snowfield, a fictional city in the United States located just outside of Las Vegas.

title: humiliation
body:
To cause a loss of pride, self-respect, or dignity. This tag is equally applicable to [[bullying]] or fetish content.

Some common humiliation actions can fall under [[public nudity]], [[abuse]], [[rape]], [[body writing]], being treated as a [[pet play|pet]], or [[recording]] someone in a compromising situation.

A character should look [[embarrassed]] or upset by the action, or appear to visibly be degraded by it. 

In most cases where a character is enthusiastically consenting with whatever is happening, the humiliation tag likely does not apply.

h4. Examples

h5. Recording someone in a compromising situation

* !post #8037883

h5. Treated as a pet

* !post #7432592

h5. Forced exposure

* !post #2780662

title: seattle_(azur_lane)
body:
[i][[Azur Lane]][/i]'s personification of the light cruiser USS [i]Seattle[/i], as part of the [i][[World of Warships]][/i] collaboration. 
Character design by [[Nineo]], voiced by [[Kusunoki Tomori]].

Seattle has [[short hair|short]] [[grey hair]], [[grey eyes]], [[large breasts]], and [[fangs]]. Her default uniform consists of a [[blue jacket]] and [[white dress]], [[white thighhighs]], a blue [[ocean sunfish]] [[fish hair ornament]], and [[fingerless gloves]]. Her [[rigging]] consists of several 152 mm [[anti-aircraft gun|dual-purpose guns]] mounted in triple [[ship turret]]s. She, along with several other ships, was introduced to the game during the second wave of Priority Ships.

h4. Skins

* !post #3480680: Default

h4. External links

* "Azur Lane Wiki: Seattle":[https://azurlane.koumakan.jp/Seattle]

title: enoshima_junko
body:
A character from [[Danganronpa: Trigger Happy Havoc]], titled the Ultimate Fashionista (超高校級の「ギャル」).

Has [[long hair|long]] and [[big hair|voluminous]] [[blonde hair]] worn in [[twintails]] and [[blue eyes]]. Wears a [[necktie]] and [[school uniform]], usually open enough to expose her [[cleavage]]. While she always wears a [[bear hair ornament]], [spoiler]her sister, [[Ikusaba Mukuro]] wears an bunny hair ornament and a hair bow, when she dresses like Junko.

[spoiler]Her true title is Ultimate Despair (超高校級の「絶望」)[/spoiler]

title: mizuhara_chizuru
body:
A character in [[Kanojo Okarishimasu]]. She is a 19-year-old (later 20-year-old) college student at Nerima University. She works part-time as a rental girlfriend. Her real name is [i]Ichinose Chizuru[/i]. [spoiler]The reason why she's working as a rental girlfriend is so that she could save money and pursue a career in acting.[/spoiler]

She has [[brown eyes]], [[large breasts]], and [[long hair|long]] [[brown hair]] with [[swept bangs]] and a [[braid]]. When not in "rental girlfriend" mode, she stylizes her hair in [[twin braids]] & wears [[glasses]].

She is voiced by [[Amamiya Sora]] in Japanese and [[Lizzie Freeman]] in English.

h4. See Also

* "Rent-a-Girlfriend: Mizuhara Chizuru":https://kanojo-okarishimasu.fandom.com/wiki/Chizuru_Ichinose

title: kukulkan_(fate)
body:
The king of the South American Lostbelt in [[Fate/Grand Order]]. Later introduced as a playable Foreigner-class Servant. Designed by [[Hiroe Rei]] and voiced by [[Suwa Ayaka]]. [spoiler] In reality, she is the ripped out heart of Lostbelt [[ORT (type-moon)|]] worshipped into becoming a sun goddess. Her personality and design are based off of [[Quetzalcoatl (fate)|]], so their mannerisms are rather similar.[/spoiler]

h4.Costumes

* [[kukulkan (first ascension) (fate)|First Ascension]]
* [[kukulkan (second ascension) (fate)|Second Ascension]]
* [[kukulkan (third ascension) (fate)|Third Ascension]]

title: tezcatlipoca_(fate)
body:
Nahuatl: "Smoking Mirror"

Assassin-class Servant currently summoned as [[Daybit Sem Void]]'s Grand Servant in [[Fate/Grand Order]]'s [[Nahui Mictlan (fate/grand order)|]] Lostbelt. Tezcatlipoca is a spider and jaguar deity in Aztec mythology, and he is fiercely at odds with [[Quetzalcoatl (fate)|]] due to their differing beliefs on human sacrifice. He was introduced as a playable character shortly after his story appearance - he is summonable as an Assassin, but appears in the story as a Ruler-class opponent. Illustrated by [[sho-u tajima]].

h4.Variants

* [[tezcatlipoca (young) (fate)|Child Tezcatlipoca]]

h4.Costumes

* [[tezcatlipoca (third ascension) (fate)|Third Ascension]]

His Servant is [[Tezcatlipoca (fate)|]], summoned by him as a Ruler, while summonable by the player as an Assassin.

title: nahui_mictlan_(fate/grand_order)
body:
[b]Lostbelt No. 7: Golden Sea of Trees Travelogue, Nahui Mictlan: Those Who Rule the Planet[/b]
[quote]The Foreign God has attacked the Wandering Sea. Chaldea escapes in the Storm Border, though at a great cost. Now they begin their attempt to enter the seventh Lostbelt and finally put a stop to the Foreign God's terrible machinations.

This seventh Lostbelt is situated in the Amazon rainforest of South America. A lush, fertile land brimming with trees, this place nurtured many forms of life. This place is said to be the wellspring of all life on Earth. But, with the Tree of Emptiness haven taken root, this place has become a wasteland of death, of cracked soil and parched earth, overhung with rumbling thunderheads.

Why is this once-lush land now dead? What course did this Lostbelt's history take?

In this harsh South American Lostbelt, devoid of all life, humanity readies itself to confront the only remaining threat.[/quote]

The seventh and final Lostbelt story arc in [[Fate/Grand Order]], taking place in South America and supervised by the Crypter [[Daybit Sem Void]].

Part 1 was released on the Japanese server on December 25, 2022, and on the NA server on December 25, 2024. Part 2 was released on the Japanese server on January 31, 2023, and on the NA server on January 15, 2025.

title: eye_of_sauron
body:
In [[Tolkien's Legendarium]], the Eye of Sauron was a symbol used by [[Sauron]]. The Eye is described as being rimmed with fire with a piercing gaze.

In Peter Jackson's film adaption of [[The Lord of the Rings]] trilogy, the Eye is depicted as a literal flaming eye atop the tower of Barad-dûr.

title: frodo_baggins
body:
Frodo Baggins is a fictional character in J. R. R. Tolkien's writings, and one of the protagonists in [[The Lord of the Rings]]. Frodo is a hobbit of the Shire who inherits [[the One Ring]] from his cousin [[Bilbo Baggins]], described familiarly as "uncle", and undertakes the quest to destroy it in the fires of Mount Doom in Mordor. He is mentioned in Tolkien's posthumously published works, [[The Silmarillion]] and Unfinished Tales.

In The Lord of the Rings film trilogy (2001–2003) directed by Peter Jackson, Frodo is played by the American actor [[Elijah Wood]].

title: aqua_(yu-gi-oh!_vrains)
body:

title: mummy
body:
A body embalmed and dried and wrapped for burial, most notably done in ancient [[Egypt]]. A mummy can also be created due to a dead body being exposed to the elements of nature, like extreme cold or humidity.

Do not apply this tag if the character is simply wrapped with [[bandage]]s, a mummy should have a large portion of their body wrapped. If it's the former case, use the tag [[mummy costume]] instead.

h4. See also

* [[corpse]]
* [[Tag Group:Legendary Creatures]]
* [[Mummy costume]]
* [[Mummification (bound)]]
* [[Mummification (non bound)]]

title: wedgie
body:
The action of "wedging" (pulling) a garment or a piece of [[underwear]] so that it's caught between the [[ass|butt]]ocks or [[labia]]. This is typically considered an act of [[humiliation]] when done on others, but considered a sexually provocative act when it's performed by oneself. It may also occur naturally.

Garments that are naturally designed to sit between the buttocks—such as [[thong]]s, [[fundoshi]], or [[g-string]]s—should typically not have this tag, unless the person is being [[giving wedgie|given a wedgie]].

For garments wedged between the [[labia]], see [[frontal wedgie]].

h4. See also

* [[self wedgie]]
* [[giving wedgie]]
* [[frontal wedgie]]
* [[atomic wedgie]]
* [[hanging wedgie]]

title: marina_(splatoon)
body:
[[Splatoon 2]] character. Named [b]Iida[/b] in the Japanese version. She is an [[octoling]].

She is part of the band Off The Hook (Tentacles in the Japanese version) with [[Pearl (splatoon)|]], which has its own television show.

Her default costume & appearance features a black [[crop top|cropped]] [[cropped vest|vest]], [[green pantyhose|green]] / [[aqua pantyhose]] under [[black shorts]], black [[boots]] and black [[fingerless gloves]]. She has a [[navel piercing]] and a [[mole under mouth|mole under her mouth]]. She has [[green eyes|green]] / [[aqua eyes]], often depicted with [[red pupils]] as [[cephalopod eyes]]. She often wears [[headphones]]. She is often depicted with a [[furrowed brow]] / [[raised eyebrows]].

Her Japanese name comes from the word for the "webfoot octopus":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Amphioctopus_fangsiao (イイダコ [i]Iidako[/i]). As revealed in [i]Octo Expansion[/i], her full name is [b]Marina Ida[/b] in English; [b]Marine Iida[/b] in Japanese.

h4. External Links

* "Inkipedia: Marina":[https://splatoonwiki.org/wiki/Marina]
other_names: イイダ(スプラトゥーン)

title: anonymous_(japanese)
body:
General tag for the Japanese equivalent to Western [[drawfag]]s.

While most commonly associated in the West with [[Futaba Channel]] anons, in particular when drawn in the yellow/beige [[imageboard colors]], this tag also includes anonymous galleries (ex. [[Asame Shinbun]]'s old gallery URL), shared [[oekaki]] imageboards between various websites, open oekaki imageboards run by individual artists (ex. [[Harada Takehito]]), and even textboards where the images are shared using third-party websites such as [[Imgur]].

If the art in question is sourced from a "matome":[https://en.wikibooks.org/wiki/2ch_Chronicle/Anti-Matome_Blog_Movement] or thread reposting website, please tag with [[third-party source]].

title: mei_(honkai_impact)
body:
[[Honkai (series)]] character.

In the [[Honkai Impact 3rd]] world, Dr. MEI was a scientist of Fire MOTH from the Previous Era. She was also the foremother of the Kaslana lineage.

In the [[Benghuai Xueyuan]] world, her full name is [[Raiden Mei]] and was a scientist and the leader of Massive Electric Corp in the Era Zero, inherited from her father [[Raiden Ryoma]].

She resembles the adult version of [[Raiden Mei]].

title: d.e.e.p._(nikke)
body:
A mysterious individual from [[Goddess of Victory: Nikke]] who proclaims to be the guardian of the Ark itself. First introduced in the event "Footstep, Walk, Run".

She is garbed from head to toe in a dark grey [[robe]] with a large [[cleavage cutout]], revealing her [[large breasts]] covered by something [[skintight]]. A [[visor]] or [[helmet]] [[covered eyes|covers her eyes]], atop which sits a polygonal headress. The only parts of her body actually visible are her mouth, chin, and some locks of [[white hair|white]] or [[grey hair]].  Refers to herself both in the first-person singular and plural interchangeably.

A pair of ordinary [[semi-rimless eyewear|semi-rimless]] [[glasses]] with [[red-framed eyewear|red frames]] are clipped to the side of her robe, just above her breasts. This has fueled wild speculation that [spoiler]she has some connection to [[Neon (nikke)|]].[/spoiler]

[spoilers]She is met by [[Red Hood (nikke)|]], who stumbles upon her chamber in the basement of the Lift. She reveals to her the Ultra Massive Core, an enormous Rapture core which is used to power the Lift, and tells her another UMC powers the Ark. The two cores are paired: if one is destroyed the other is destroyed as well.[/spoilers]

title: illyasviel_von_einzbern
body:
A character from [[Fate/Stay Night]]. She is voiced by [[Kadowaki Mai]], and her nickname is Illya.

A young German aristocrat competing in the 5th Holy Grail War. Due to her white-blonde hair and red eyes, she is often considered an albino by fans. Her Servant is Berserker [[Heracles (fate)|]].

She appears in [[Fate/Grand Order]] as an Alter Ego Servant [[Sitonai (fate)|]], as a composite of Sitonai, Freyja, and Louhi.

Another version of her is a fifth-grade [[magical girl]] in the spinoff [[Fate/Kaleid Liner Prisma Illya]], who also appears in Fate/Grand Order as a Caster-class Servant.

h4.Costumes

Note that since it's difficult to tell Illyasviel apart from her Pseudo-Servant form [[Sitonai (fate)|]], costumes for both characters will be categorized here.

title: silent_hill:_homecoming
body:
Silent Hill: Homecoming is the sixth installment in the [[Silent Hill (series)|]] series. Homecoming follows the journey of [[Alex Shepherd]], a soldier returning from war, to his hometown of Shepherd's Glen, where he finds the town in disarray, and his younger brother missing.
The game was released on September 30, 2008, in North America for the [[PlayStation 3]] and [[Xbox 360]], and the Windows version was released in North America on November 6, 2008, exclusively through Valve's Steam digital content delivery service.

h4. External links

* "Wikipedia: Silent Hill: Homecoming":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Silent_Hill:_Homecoming]

title: alex_shepherd
body: The protagonist of [[Silent Hill: Homecoming]], the sixth installment in the [[Silent Hill (series)|]] series. Alex comes home to find that his father, and later his brother Joshua, have disappeared, and his mother has gone into a catatonic state. Alex begins to search for his brother, leading him through his hometown of Shepherd's Glen and ultimately to Silent Hill.

title: yukikaze_(azur_lane)
body:
The personification of the Japanese destroyer [i]Yukikaze[/i] (雪風) in [[Azur Lane]]. 
Character design by [[Saru]], voiced by [[Yuuki Kana (voice Actor)|]].

Yukikaze has [[long hair|long]] [[white hair]], [[cat ears]] with [[animal ear fluff]] and [[orange eyes]]. She wears several [[black bow|black bows]] in her hair as well as around both arms. Her outfit consists of a modified [[serafuku]], where she has a [[crop top]] and a [[black sailor collar]]. The lower portion consists of a [[black skirt|black]] [[pleated skirt|pleated]] [[miniskirt]] which is attached to the top by means of a nondescript black strap. She wears [[ribbon-trimmed legwear|ribbon-trimmed]], [[white legwear|white]] [[thighhighs]] and short, [[rudder footwear|rudder]] high heels with a cat's paw under each shoe.

Her [[rigging]] consists of a single quad [[torpedo tubes|torpedo tube]], a single twin [[ship turret|turret]] and a [[smokestack]].

body:

Her base attributes are [[long hair|long]] [[black hair]] done in a [[hime cut]], [[green eyes]], [[red horns]], and a horned [[familiar]] wielding a [[naginata]].

She is portrayed as a [[miko]] and is dressed as such, sporting a [[white kimono]] and red [[hakama skirt]] as her default outfit. Her [[rigging]] consists of two separate hull pieces that each contain [[shide]], two 140 mm single gun mounts, and 610 mm twin [[torpedo tubes]]. She also uses a miniature version of her real-life bridge and foremast as a hand-held accessory.

title: yuudachi_(azur_lane)
body:
Personification of the fourth ship of the [i]Shiratsuyu[/i]-class destroyers, [i]Yuudachi[/i] (夕立), in [[Azur Lane]].

Introducing herself as the "Mad Dog of Solomon", her personality takes the dog-like mannerisms that fans gave her [[yuudachi (kancolle)|Kantai Collection counterpart]] and dials them up even further. Yuudachi is highly aggressive, often growling and even outright howling. Like many dogs, she is also food-motivated, and often cannot stop thinking about the consumption of freshly-cooked meat.

Character design by [[Saru]], voiced by [[Takamori Natsumi]].

Yuudachi has [[long hair|long]] [[silver hair]] tied into at least one [[side ponytail]] on her right and a [[braid]] from her left sidelock. She has [[red eyes]], [[wolf ears]] with metal plates over the outside, and a [[wolf tail]]. Like Shigure, her outfit consists of a modified [[serafuku]], with a white [[crop top]], [[puffy short sleeves]], a [[black sailor collar]], and a [[red ribbon]]. Below the waist, she wears a [[black skirt|black]] [[pleated skirt|pleated]] [[miniskirt]], [[white legwear|white]] [[loose socks]] and [[red footwear|red]] [[rudder footwear|rudder]] [[high heels]]. Additionally, she has [[fingerless gloves]] with red and white leather [[cuffs]], [[stuffed wolf]] toy near her hip, and a rose [[tattoo]] on her right hip.

Her [[rigging]] has a single twin [[ship turret|turret]] on her right, a quad [[torpedo tubes|torpedo tube]] on her right, and a [[smokestack]] on her back. These are all in solid black and white paint-scheme.

title: kearsarge_(azur_lane)
body:
[[Azur Lane]]'s personification of the battleship-carrier hybrid USS [i]Kearsarge[/i], as part of the [[World of Warships]] collaboration. 

She has [[very long hair|very long]] [[white hair]] with black [[hair ornament]]s, [[purple eyes]], and [[large breasts]]. 

Her default outfit is a strapless [[white leotard|white]] [[thong leotard]] meant to represent the shape of her flight deck, [[white jacket|white]] [[cropped jacket]], [[mismatched legwear|mismatched]] [[asymmetrical legwear]] ([[white thighhighs|white thighhigh]] on her left and [[black footwear|black]] [[thigh boots|thigh boot]] on her right), and [[black gloves]]. Because of the peculiar way her leotard was worn (as it only covers the frontal half of her body and only held together with a [[crotch plate]] between her butt locks), this leave her [[bare back]] and her [[ass]] completely exposed.

Her [[rigging]] consists of a large mechanical and small natural [[halo]] above her plus white hull pieces with all four of her 406 mm triple mounts. Her design got a small change featuring her Flight Deck appearing on each side and a squadron of [[F8F Bearcat]]s.

Character design by [[YD (orange maru)|]], voiced by [[Aoyama Yoshino]]. 

h4. Skins

title: nagato_(azur_lane)
body:
[[Azur Lane]]'s personification of the Japanese battleship [i]Nagato[/i]. 

In contrast to her ship class, she is portrayed as a child(-like?) character. She wears a red pleated [[sleeveless dress]] similar to a hakama with detached sleeves and what seems to be a jacket(?). Her equipment dwarfs her and consists of 4 double guns decorated with [[shimenawa]] in a split bow configuration with her spire/pagoda mast towering behind her, all seemingly held in mid-air with floating pauldrons and a semi-transparent cape. She has long black hair in a [[hime cut]] with bird-like decorations to her temples as well as golden yellow eyes. Like many ships of the Sakura Empire, she has [[animal ears]] of her hair color. Those are inferred to be [[fox ears]] from her wedding portrait (where she is surrounded by numerous white foxes).

Her young appearance may be a reference to how Japanese schoolchildren donated funds for the two battleships, especially [[Mutsu (Azur Lane)|]].

As she looks like - and perhaps [i]is[/i] - a little girl, she is often contrasted with [[Nagato (kancolle)|]] from [[Kantai Collection]], to the point where the latter goes "Nagamon":/pools/8242 after "herself".

Character design by [[Alisa (kuro no sakura)|]], voiced by [[Kuno Misaki]].

title: yorck_(azur_lane)
body:
[[Azur Lane]]'s personification of the Imperial German Navy heavy cruiser SMS [i]Yorck[/i].

Not to be confused with the Royal Navy heavy cruiser HMS [[York (Azur Lane)|]] due to pronunciation; while the Japanese katakana is "YORUKU" for Yorck, York's is "YO-KU".

h4. Appearance

h4. History
In real life, [i]Yorck[/i] was the second and last member of the Roon-class armored cruisers (reclassed as CA in Azur Lane). By the time she was commissioned in 1905, the first battlecruisers entering service quickly made armored cruisers like her obsolete.

Prior to World War I, she was involved in training cruises and mishaps before being sent to reserve in 1913. In July 1914, she was returned to service in time for the war, but did not last long as she was sunk in a German minefield in early November that same year.

body:

Character designed by [[yyy (zelda10010)|]]. 

Her name (應瑞, [i]Yinrui[/i] if Hanyu Pinyin) means "propitious promises".
In the game, she and her sister [[Chao Ho (Azur Lane)|]] are reclassed as light cruisers to conform to existing ship types. 

h4. Appearance

She is portrayed with [[long hair|long]] [[two-tone hair]] ([[purple hair|purple]] and [[white hair|white]]) tied into [[double bun|two]] [[cone hair bun]]s, [[purple eyes]], and [[medium breasts]]. 

Her outfit is basically the same as her sister, replacing the red color dress with [[purple dress|purple]] and her [[single thighhigh]] is on her right leg.

title: 100-series
body:
The 100-Series Observational Realians were a series of artificial humanoids in the [[Xenosaga]] series.  They all had the appearance of a young girl with light skin, light [[blue hair]], and [[yellow_eyes|yellow]] or [[brown eyes]].

They were the successor series to the [[kirschwasser|99-Series Realians]] and were modeled after their prototype, [[MOMO Mizrahi]].

title: kirschwasser
body:
The Kirschwassers, or formally the 99-Series Observational Realians, were a series of artificial humanoids in the [[Xenosaga]] series.  They all had the appearance of a young girl with [[dark skin]], [[white hair]], and [[yellow_eyes|yellow]] or [[brown eyes]].

They were the predecessor to the [[100-Series]] Realians and were involved in the development and creation of [[MOMO Mizrahi]].

After being abandoned they met [[Albedo Piazzolla]] and became his followers.

title: fire_emblem:_the_binding_blade
body:
The sixth game in the [[Fire Emblem]] franchise, released for the [[Game Boy Advance]] in 2001 exclusively in Japan.

Originally developed for the [[Nintendo 64]], it is notable for being the first game in the series that did not involve series creator Shouzou Kaga in its development.

[[Fire Emblem: The Blazing Blade]] is a direct prequel to this game.

title: bucky_barnes
body:
James Buchanan "Bucky" Barnes is a [[Marvel]] character. He is the civilian identity of the brainwashed cyborg assassin called the [[Winter Soldier]].

Originally introduced as a sidekick to [[Captain America]], the character was created by Joe Simon and Jack Kirby and first appeared in Captain America Comics #1 (cover-dated March 1941). Barnes' original costume (or one based on it) and the Bucky nickname have been used by other heroes in the Marvel Universe over the years.

Sebastian Stan plays the character in the [[Marvel Cinematic Universe]].
other_names: ジェームズ・ブキャナン・バーンズ

title: musashi_(azur_lane)
body:
The personification of the Japanese battleship [i]Musashi[/i] in [[Azur Lane]]. Character design by [[Dishwasher1910]], voiced by [[Lynn (voice actor)|]]. 

Like her sister ship [[Shinano (Azur Lane)|]] and many Sakura Empire capital ships, she is a [[fox girl]]/[[kitsune]] with [[fox ears]] and [[fox tail|tails]], with [[very long hair|very long]] dark [[purple hair]], [[brown eyes]], [[facial mark]]s, and [[large breasts]].

Her default outfit is also similar to Shinano's, but colored black, with a [[fur trim]] and a very [[low neckline]], blue print [[obi]], and possessing a [[magatama necklace]], big [[purple gemstone]] in the middle [[prayer beads]], and giant [[magatama]] on the beads. Her [[rigging]] consists of two giant mechanical hands similar to [i]Indianapolis[/i]' own rig but with two 15.5 cm triple secondary guns (one on each side), all three of her historical 460 mm triple main gun mounts on separate attachments, and a disembodied familiar behind her wielding a giant [[katana]] using the aforementioned mechanical arms.

The historical IJN [i]Musashi[/i] was commissioned in mid-1942 as the second ship of the [i]Yamato[/i]-class, and was sunk on October 24, 1944 during the battle of Leyte Gulf. Her final resting place was "subsequently found":https://ph.news.yahoo.com/sunken-japanese-wwii-battleship-located-philippines-210741638.html on March 2, 2015 in the Sibuyan Sea, Romblon province, Philippines, by an expedition team led by Paul Allen. 

h4. Skins

* !post #5674654: Default
* !post #5674659: [[musashi (violet moonglow) (azur lane)|Violet Moonglow]] 
* !post #7661325: [[musashi (purest wisteria) (azur lane)|Purest Wisteria]] (Wedding skin)
* !post #8208030: [[musashi (the purple rabbit's marksmanship) (azur lane)|The Purple Rabbit's Marksmanship]]

h5. Unofficial skins designed by original author
* !post #5708182: dancer

h4. See also

* [[Musashi (Kancolle)]]
* [[Musashi (Aoki Hagane no Arpeggio)]]

h4. External links

She has 3 different [[official alternate hairstyle|official hairstyles]] in this costume:

title: princess_peach_(yukata)_(super_mario_odyssey)
body:
[[Princess Peach]] dressed in a [[yukata]], first appearing in [i][[Super Mario Odyssey]][/i] when her and [[Tiara (mario)|Tiara]] travel to Bowser's Kingdom. 

She's dressed in a [[white kimono|white]] [[yukata]] with [[fire flower]]s [[floral print|printed]] on it, wrapped in a light [[blue sash|blue]] [[obi]]. On her feet she wears a pair of [[brown footwear|brown]] [[geta]] with light blue straps. She has a [[Boo (Mario)|Boo]] [[character mask|mask]] [[mask on head|on her head]] and her hair is tied up in a [[ponytail]]. She's often holding an [[uchiwa]] that has the image a [[blooper (mario)|Blooper]] on it.

Unlike some other Peach outfits from Super Mario Odyssey, this one never appeared in [i][[Mario Kart Tour]][/i], so it lacks an official name. Though a similar design, [[Princess Peach (Yukata)]], was introduced in it's stead.

title: starscream
body:
A character from the [[Transformers]] science fiction franchise.

[b]Starscream[/b] is an evil [i]Seeker[/i] [[Decepticon]], a sentient alien [[robot]] that can transform into a red, blue and silver [[F-15 eagle]] [[fighter jet]] (in the G1 cartoons) and later a completely gray [[F-22 raptor]] (in the live action movies and some games). His Japanese fan-nickname is StaSc/StaSuku. 

Deceptive and evil, even by Decepticon's standards. Starscream's notable trait is his eagerness to betray his own comrades for his own gain. As such, he is often depicted as a rival - even usurper - to [[Megatron]] for the leadership of Decepticons.

[quote]Motto: [i]"Conquest is made of the ashes of one's enemies...".[/i][/quote]

h4. See also

body:

This calendar was given as a reward for Club Nintendo members. This is the second time Peach has ever been depicted in a kimono in official promotional art. 

She's in a [[pink kimono|pink]] [[kimono]] that is covered in [[floral print|flower patterns]], wears a [[hirabitai]] on her head and carries a yellow [[hand fan]]. In the official art she is seen sitting on a [[hinadan]] with [[bonbori_(lighting)|bonbori]] at both of her sides.

title: phan_phan
body:
Phan Phan is a character in the [[kirby (series)|Kirby series]].
Phan Phan first appeared in [[Kirby: Nightmare in Dream Land]]. He replaced [[Rolling Turtle]] that appeared in [[Kirby's Adventure]].
It looks like an [[elephant]] with two legs.
It attacks [[Kirby]] by curling up and rolling, throwing Kirby away with its long [[trunk]], and rolling [[apple]].
When Kirby inhales Phan Phan, he copies [[Throw kirby|Throw]] or [[Suplex kirby|Suplex]]”.

title: bugzzy
body:
Bugzzy is a character in the [[kirby_(series)|Kirby series]].
He first appeared in [[Kirby's Adventure]].
He looks like a large [[stag beetle]]. He specializes in an attack in which he holds [[Kirby]] between his horns and then slams him down. It also releases [[ladybug|ladybugs]].
From him you can [[copy ability|copy abilities]] such as “[[Backdrop kirby|Backdrop]]” or “[[Suplex kirby|Suplex]]”.

In [[Kirby: right back at ya|Kirby: right back at ya!]], Bugzzy does not use his horns, but a [[club (weapon)|club]] and large [[sword|swords]] in his hands.
Kirby couldn't [[inhaling|inhale]] Bugzzy, but he did get the [[Sword kirby|Sword]] by inhaling Bugzzy's sword.

title: david_lynch
body:
David Keith Lynch (January 20, 1946 – January 15, 2025) was an American filmmaker, visual artist, musician, and actor. He received acclaim for his films, which are often distinguished by their surrealist, dreamlike qualities. In a career spanning more than fifty years, he was awarded numerous accolades, including the Golden Lion for Lifetime Achievement at the Venice Film Festival in 2006 and an Honorary Academy Award in 2019. Often described as a "visionary", Lynch was considered one of the most important filmmakers of his era.

Lynch studied painting before he began making short films in the late 1960s. His first feature-length film was the independent surrealist film [[Eraserhead]] (1977), which saw success as a midnight movie. He was nominated for the Academy Award for Best Director for the biographical drama The Elephant Man (1980), the neo-noir thriller Blue Velvet (1986), and the surrealist mystery Mulholland Drive (2001). His romantic crime drama Wild at Heart (1990) won the Palme d'Or at the Cannes Film Festival. He also directed [[Dune (1984 movie)|the 1984 adaptation of Dune]], the surrealist neo-noir Lost Highway (1997), the biographical drama The Straight Story (1999), and the experimental film Inland Empire (2006).

Lynch and Mark Frost created the ABC series [[Twin Peaks]] (1990–91), for which he was nominated for five Primetime Emmy Awards, including Outstanding Directing for a Drama Series and Outstanding Writing for a Drama Series. Lynch co-wrote and directed its film prequel, Twin Peaks: Fire Walk with Me (1992), and a third season in 2017.
other_names: デイヴィッド・リンチ

title: kine_(kirby)
body:
An ocean sunfish who befriends [[kirby|Kirby]] in [i][[kirby's_dream_land_2|Kirby's Dream Land 2]][/i] and [i][[kirby's_dream_land_3|Kirby's Dream Land 3]][/i]. He allows Kirby to swim more efficiently and synergizes with [[copy_ability|copy abilities]] in ways that can behave differently based on land and water.

After a number of cameos since then, he makes a return in [i][[kirby:_star_allies|Kirby Star Allies]][/i] alongside fellow animal friends [[rick_(kirby)|Rick]] and [[coo_(kirby)|Coo]], where the trio comes together as a Dream Friend. They were part of the first wave of post-launch Dream Friends alongside [[marx (kirby)|Marx]] and [[gooey (kirby)|Gooey]].

title: index_(toaru_majutsu_no_index)
body:
Index Librorum Prohibitorum is the eponymous character of [[ToAru Majutsu no Index]]. Commonly known as Index, she is the main female character of the Magic Side. She is a member of Necessarius and has Perfect Memory and is not poisoned by the effects of reading grimoires. As such, she holds within herself 103,000 magical grimoires at the beginning of the series.

Index looks like she is 14-15, one year or two younger than Touma. She is small in stature (148 cm), has a petite build, and, much to her chagrin, a [[flat chest]]. She has [[very long hair|thigh length]], light [[grey hair]], and large [[green eyes]]. She is also often seen wearing her Walking Church, a white, and modified [[nun]]'s habit with gold highlights. It is an accurate replica of the Holy Shroud of Turin and offered Index ultimate protection from most attacks, however, it was destroyed by Touma's right hand. She still wears it, though [[safety pin]]s are now needed to hold it together.

h4. See also

* [[Index (John's Pen Mode) (ToAru)|]]
* [[Sphinx (ToAru Majutsu no Index)|]]

title: fire_kirby
body: A common [[copy ability]] throughout the [[Kirby (series)|Kirby]] series where [[Kirby]] gains the ability to [[breathing fire|breathe fire]]. In this form, Kirby wears a [[gold headwear|gold]] [[circlet]] with a [[green gemstone]] in the middle, along with his head being on [[fire]]. Related Abilities: * [[Burning Kirby|Burning]] : It is incorporated as part of the Fire's attack. * [[Monster Flame Kirby|Monster Flame]] * [[Volcano Fire Kirby|Volcano Fire]] * [[Dragon Fire Kirby|Dragon Fire]]

title: jet_kirby
body:
A [[copy ability]] that appears in [[Kirby Super Star]], [[Kirby Super Star Ultra|its remake]], and [[Kirby: Planet Robobot]] that enables [[Kirby]] to use a [[jetpack]] and [[flying|fly]].

In this form, Kirby wears a [[white headwear|white]] [[two-tone headwear|and]] [[blue headwear|blue]] [[hat]] that resembles a [[fighter jet]] with a pair of black-tinted [[goggles]] that act as its [[visor]].

title: throw_kirby
body:
A [[Copy Ability]] used by [[Kirby]], letting him inhale enemies and throw them.

Starting in [i][[Kirby: Nightmare in Dream Land]][/i], Throw Kirby wears a [[blue headband]]. This makes him look like [[Suplex Kirby]] in [i][[Kirby Super Star]][/i], but unlike Suplex, Throw does not change Kirby's color more than other abilities.

title: mecha_kirby
body:
A [[copy ability]] that appears in [[Kirby's Return to Dream Land Deluxe]] which turns [[Kirby]] into a [[mecha]].

!asset #24547302: Icon

When in this form, Kirby wears a [[blue headwear|blue]] [[helmet]] with a futuristic [[yellow-tinted eyewear|yellow]] [[visor]]. This helmet comes with a couple [[mechanical arms]] and [[cannon|cannons]] that can function as a [[jetpack]].

title: bomb_kirby
body: A common [[copy ability]] throughout the [[kirby (series)|Kirby]] series that lets [[Kirby]] throw [[bomb|bombs]]. !asset #24553634: Icon This form's appearance has varied over the years, but in its modern form, Kirby wears a [[blue headwear|blue]] [[cone hat]] with a [[fireworks print]], a [[blue gemstone]] in its center, and a [[red ribbon|red]] [[hat ribbon]] at its end. Its older form has Kirby wear a floppy [[blue headwear|blue]] [[hat]] with a [[pom pom (clothes)|pom pom]] at its tip. Evolved Forms: * [[Chain Bomb Kirby]] * [[Homing Bomb Kirby]]

title: cutter_kirby
body: A common [[copy ability]] throughout the [[kirby_(series)|Kirby]] series that lets [[Kirby]] throw [[boomerang|boomerangs]] at his enemies, as well as cut ropes in later games. !asset #24553653: Icon In this form, Kirby wears a [[yellow headwear|yellow]] [[baseball cap]] decorated with [[wing hat ornament|wings]] on the sides, as well as [[eye print|eyes]] on the front, making it almost resemble a [[duck]]. When not in use, a [[boomerang]] rests on top of the hat. It is also inspired by [[Ultraseven]]'s [[Eye Slugger]]. Evolved Forms: * [[Chakram Cutter Kirby]] * [[Buzz-Saw Cutter kirby]]

title: gigant_sword_kirby
body: An evolved form of [[Sword Kirby]] in [[Kirby and the Forgotten Land]]. Resembles the common midboss [[Gigant Edge]] in this form.

title: tulip_hat
body:
Similar in appearance to a [[bucket hat]] or [[cloche_hat]], the tulip hat typically has no defined brim, nor a ribbon/belt to create the appearance of one, and often has ribbing or panels dividing the hat into vertical sections more reminiscent of the namesake tulip. It can be further embellished with elements that make it look more like an upside down flower, or by rounding the panels to give it a wavy brim.

title: shokuhou_misaki
body:
A [[ToAru Majutsu no Index]] character. First mentioned in [i]Index[/i], but officially introduced in the [[ToAru Kagaku no Railgun]] manga, and main character of the [[ToAru Kagaku no Mental Out]] manga, Misaki is Academy City's 5th ranked [[Level 5 (ToAru)|]]. 

Nicknamed Mental Out (心理掌握 [i]Shinri Shouaku[/i], lit. Psychological Control) after her ability, which allows for a wide range of effects, including telepathy and mind control. Also nicknamed The Queen of Tokiwadai, she is the second Level 5 enrolled in Tokiwadai Middle School, along with [[Misaka Mikoto]]. They're often at odds with each other.

She has [[very long hair|very]] [[long hair|long]] [[blonde hair]], [[yellow eyes|yellow]]/[[brown eyes]] with [[star-shaped pupils]], and [[large breasts]]. She is 168-169 cm tall.

She wears the standard [[Tokiwadai school uniform]] with [[white gloves|white]] [[spider web print]] [[elbow gloves]] and [[white thighhighs|white]] [[thighhighs]] with the same print. She typically carries around a [[handbag]] and a [[holding remote control|remote control]].

In [[Blue Archive]] she has a [[pink halo|pink]] [[star halo]] similar to her star-shaped pupils. She carries a [[Staccato 2011]] pistol as an additional firearm.

h4. External links

* "Toaru Majutsu no Index Wiki: Shokuhou Misaki":http://toarumajutsunoindex.wikia.com/wiki/Shokuhou_Misaki
other_names: 食蜂操祈(ブルーアーカイブ)

title: misaka_mikoto
body:
An [[electricity]]-wielding middle schooler from [[ToAru Majutsu no Index]], and protagonist of the spinoff manga [[ToAru Kagaku no Railgun]].

She has the ability to [[electrokinesis|use electricity]] in various ways, such as shooting it, using it to shoot other items as projectiles (hence her nickname [[railgun (misaka mikoto)|]]), and electromagnetism.

She has [[brown eyes]], [[medium hair|medium]] [[brown hair]], and [[small breasts]], [[breast envy|much to her chagrin]]. She also wears a [[hairpin]].

She wears the standard [[Tokiwadai school uniform]] with [[short shorts]] [[shorts under skirt|under her skirt]] and [[loose socks|loose]] [[white_socks|white]] [[ankle socks]].

In [[Blue Archive]], her halo features a [[lightning bolt symbol]]. She also wields a modified [[FN F2000]] named "Gunvolt" (itself a reference to "[[Azure Striker Gunvolt]]", hence the name).

h4. Related characters

* [[Misaka Imouto]]: Looks about the same but usually has a [[night vision device]].  Also, while Mikoto has shorts on under her skirt, this one only has [[striped panties]].
* [[Dolly (toaru kagaku no railgun)|]]: Looks about the same but usually has [[long hair]].
* [[Last Order (toaru Majutsu No Index)|]]: Much [[child|younger]] looking than the other two and the only one with an [[ahoge]].
* [[Misaka Worst]]: Looks slightly [[aged up]] and wears a light [[grey bodysuit]] (in a [[ToAru Majutsu no Index: Old Testament|WWIII arc]]) or a [[white dress|white]] [[Ao dai]] (in a [[ToAru Majutsu no Index: New Testament|New Testament]]). 
* [[Misaka Misuzu]]: Mikoto's [[mother and daughter|mother]]. Looks very young for [[mature female|her age]] (just slightly older than Misaka Worst) and has [[large breasts]].

h4. See also

* [[Gekota]]
* [[Misaka Mikoto level 6 shift]]
* [[Only My Railgun (meme)]]
* [[Railgun (Misaka Mikoto)]]

title: bremerton_(azur_lane)
body:
[[Azur Lane]]'s personification of the US Navy heavy cruiser USS [i]Bremerton[/i] (CA-130). Character design by [[Katsudansou]].

She has [[pink eyes]] and [[pink hair]] with [[grey hair|grey]] [[streaked hair]], tied in [[twintails]] with [[hair intakes]]. Other minor details include a [[mole]] [[mole under eye|under her right eye]] and [[mole on breast|right breast]]. Her most notable features, however, are her very [[large breasts]], and [[ear piercing|ear]] and [[navel piercing]]s. This, combined with her overall design, caused her to be associated with [[gyaru]] stereotypes.

Her outfit consists of a [[crop top]] (usually depicted as [[crop top overhang]]) and [[black shorts|black]] [[short shorts]] worn over a [[pink bikini|pink]] [[bikini]], a [[lifebuoy ornament|lifebuoy]]-shaped [[black choker]], black [[thighhighs]], and [[black footwear|black]] [[ankle boots]]. Her "combat outfit" also features an [[blue coat|indigo coat]] bearing her designation and a [[red-tinted eyewear|red]] [[aviator sunglasses]].

title: you_look_lonely_(meme)
body:
You Look Lonely, also known as Sad Officer [[k (blade runner 2049)|K]], refers to a scene from 2017 film [[Blade Runner 2049]] in which the main protagonist K, played by [[Ryan Gosling]], silently watches a giant holographic advertisement for his [spoiler]recently destroyed[/spoiler] "virtual girlfriend" [[Joi]], after having been badly injured. Following the film's trailer and release, the scene circulated as an exploitable, with K and Joi usually replaced with other characters. As the meme developed, K's face bathed in purple light became widely used as an image macro expressing sadness and despair.

h4. External links

* "Know Your Meme: You Look Lonely":[https://knowyourmeme.com/memes/you-look-lonely]

title: ragnarok_online
body:
A Korean MMORPG based on the manhwa Ragnarok by [[Myung-Jin Lee]], released in 2002 by Gravity Co., Ltd, using the engine from their previous game [[Arcturus]]. Its popularity spawned the anime [[Ragnarok the Animation]]. 

Due to numerous hacks that leaked the source code during the beta years of the game, semi-legal emulated private servers became the most popular way to play for non-East Asian gamers. The game's overall settings and design, particularly its class system, would go on to inspire numerous fantasy MMORPG and media. The franchise itself received several spin-offs and reboots over the years.

title: jojolion
body:
Part 8 of the manga [[JoJo no Kimyou na Bouken]], taking place in the [[Steel Ball Run]] universe in present-day Japan.

Shares its setting, the fictional town of Morioh, with Part 4: [[Diamond wa Kudakenai|Diamond is Unbreakable]].

The [[2011 Sendai earthquake and tsunami]] is an important plot point.

title: steel_ball_run
body:
Part 7 of [[JoJo no Kimyou na Bouken]], though separate from the "main" timeline of Parts 1-6. The part marked an entirely new continuity for the series. 

Vaguely an alternate universe analogue of Part 1: [[Phantom Blood]], this time based around a cross-country horse race taking place in America in the 1890s.

It was followed by part 8 [[JoJolion]], which continues the story left off from part 7.

title: lord_el-melloi_ii
body:
Future version of [[Waver Velvet]].

[spoiler]He is only a steward of the title, having been given it by [[Reines El-Melloi Archisorte]], the proper heir of the house of El-Melloi. This was both in recognition of his accomplishments, as well as in exchange for assisting the El-Melloi after the destabilizing impact made by the death of [[Kayneth El-Melloi Archibald|Kayneth Archibald]].[/spoiler]

Can be summoned in [[Fate/Grand Order]] under the Caster designation, but as the host body of Zhuge Liang (similar to how [[Tohsaka Rin]] is the host of Ishtar).

[spoiler]He is responsible for dismantling the Holy Grail after the fifth Holy Grail War. He is also the only surviving master of the 4th Grail War, following the deaths of [[Emiya Kiritsugu]] and [[Kotomine Kirei]].[/spoiler]

[[Tohsaka Rin]]'s lecturer at the Magus Association and possesses an interest in the popular culture of Japan (though he likes little else about the country).

Featured as the eponymous protagonist of [[Lord El-Melloi II Case Files]] novel series written by Sanda Makoto and illustrated by Mineji Sakamoto.

title: nintendo_switch
body:
[[Nintendo|Nintendo's]] seventh game console, released in the Eighth Generation of consoles and the successor to the [[Wii U]]. Known as the NX during development. The first production model went on sale on March 3rd, 2017. 

The Nintendo Switch has two dedicated [[game controller]]s (one for each hand) called [[Joy-Con]]s. These can be attached to and removed from the console at will, essentially making it a hybrid home/handheld platform.

A smaller version, the [[nintendo switch lite|Switch Lite]], was revealed July 10th, 2019, built strictly for handheld gaming. The Lite has no detachable Joy-Cons; the controllers are hard-built into the console. It also has no HDMI output so cannot be connected to a TV like the original model Switch can. 

The platform has enjoyed a positive reception and high sales numbers in the years since its release. In addition to carrying many popular flagship titles like [[The Legend of Zelda: Breath of the Wild]] and [[Super Mario Odyssey]], the Switch has also become a welcoming home for many older games from last-gen systems. This led the Switch to be the [i]de facto[/i] portable way to play popular older titles like [[Diablo 3]], [[Dark Souls I]] and [[Castle Crashers]] which had previously only been playable on non-portable platforms. As of early 2023, the combined Switch product line is one of the best-selling platforms in Nintendo's entire history, outselling both the [[Wii]] and the [[Game Boy]] and now second only to the [[Nintendo DS]].

For tagging purposes, if the Switch has its Joy-Cons detached (or is being controlled by other compatible controllers), tag it as a [[game console]] (post #3259420, post #3528468). If the Switch has at least one Joy-Con connected or the console itself is the Lite, tag it as a [[handheld game console]] (post #3471232, post #3470179).

h4. See also

* [[Nintendo Switch 2]]
* [[Nintendo Switch Pro Controller]]
* [[Nintendo Switch Lite]]
* [[Ring-Con]]
* [[List of game consoles]]

title: sukonbu_(shirakami_fubuki)
body:
Mascots representing the fans of [[Shirakami Fubuki]], designed by [[shirakami_fubuki_(artist)|Fubuki]] herself (post #4545004).

They are tiny [[chibi]] white foxes with yellow tails surrounded by two green shrouds that, as a whole, resembles an ear of corn (maize), which is Fubuki's fan mark: 🌽. They also have Fubuki's earring and black inner ear fur and adds aqua facial streaks, three on the forehead and one on each cheek.

Depending on where they come from, the Sukonbu have different accessories assigned to them. The Sukonbu proper, the japanese fans, wear a scarf similar to Fubuki's in her original outfit. The "Friends", which are the foreign fans, wear ribbons similar to the one in Fubuki's lolita outfit. All of them have an accessory at the knot which resembles an orange X but is based on Gold Osmanthus blossoms.

That being said, Fubuki encourages her fans to personalize their Sukonbu avatars by adding or changing their accessories. They can also be given different eye colors other than simple black ovals, giving her green-blue eye color and Kurokami's red eye color as an example.

h4. Appearence

* !post #4545004

Additionally, he might accessorize with a [[black hat|black]] [[gakuseibou]].

He also always carries a [[katana]] with him.

title: transformers_one
body: Transformers One is a 2024 American animated science fiction action film based on Hasbro's [[Transformers]] toy line. It was directed by Josh Cooley from a screenplay by Eric Pearson and the writing duo of Andrew Barrer and Gabriel Ferrari, based on a story by Barrer and Ferrari. The ensemble voice cast includes [[Chris Hemsworth]], Brian Tyree Henry, [[Scarlett Johannson]], Keegan-Michael Key, Steve Buscemi, Laurence Fishburne, and Jon Hamm. It is set on Cybertron, the home planet of the Transformers and depicts the origins and early relationship of [[Optimus Prime]] and [[Megatron]].

title: orion_(star_trek)
body:
A fictional humanoid [[alien]] race from the [[Star Trek]] series. Known for their [[green skin]]. Originated in the pilot of the original series with an exotic dancer dubbed the 'Orion Animal Woman'.

Once a technologically advanced species of explorers and traders, the Orions eventually devolved into one of the most notorious races of pirates and slavers. The Orion Syndicate was known and feared widely as one of the preeminent organized crime organizations, and much of their culture became centered around it.

Notable quirks of the Orions are their matriarchal society and the potent pheromones Orion females produce. In some cases, female leaders conceal their identity and allow themselves to be trafficked, using these pheromones to compromise rival organizations. In other cases, female Orions in mixed species populations (like Starfleet) have had to take measures to control this trait to fit in.

h4.See also
* [[D'vana Tendi]]

body: Purity seals typically take the form of [[parchment]] inscribed with declarations or prayers and tend to be affixed to a surface via a [[wax seal]]. They are prominently displayed on [[armor]], [[weapon|weaponry]], and vehicles, and indicate that the wearer/item is free of corruption.

title: psyco_gundam
body:
A fictional [[mecha]] from the [[Gundam]] series. It first appeared in [[Zeta Gundam]] from 1985.

[b]MRX-009 Psyco Gundam[/b]

A huge variable [[Mobile Suit]] (sometines labeled a [[Mobile Armor]] due to its secondary configuration on which it can transform) developed by the [[titans_(gundam)|Titans]] to be piloted by Newtypes and Cyber-Newtypes. It resembles a colossal black Gundam (due to many of its experimental equipments such as the Psycommu, which gives it its name, being still new and not yet optimized in size). It was operated primarily by [[Four Murasame]].

[spoiler]Cyber-Newtype [[Jill Ratokie]] was killed testing this mecha. The Psyco-Gundam is often referred to as an "evil machine" due to the fact that its psycommu is actually reversed in order to control the pilot and force them to fight. This technology was derived from the one used in the old [[Zeon]] [[Elmeth]] MA.[/spoiler]

Evolved into the [[Psyco Gundam Mk II]].

h4. See also
* [[Psyco Gundam Mk III]]

title: mannlicher_m1886
body:
Ferdinand Mannlicher's first straight-pull [[bolt action]] [[rifle]] that was designed in 1886, to serve as the standard infantry weapon for [[Austria-Hungary]]. The rifle was quickly made obsolete by the introduction of the Lebel Model 1886 rifle with its new smokeless cartridge. As such it was quickly replaced in Austrian service by more modern Mannlicher rifles, up to [[Mannlicher m1895]].

It used a wedge-lock straight pull action bolt. It was the first straight-pull bolt-action service rifle of any nation.

h1. External links
* "Wikipedia: Mannlicher M1886":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/mannlicher_m1886

title: brest_(azur_lane)
body:
[i][[Azur Lane]][/i]'s personification of the French large cruiser [i]Brest[/i], as part of the [i][[World of Warships]][/i] collaboration.
Character design by [[Kurumi (Recycllamo)]].

Brest is a cruiser with 330 mm quad mount main battery guns concentrated at the bow in a style similar to the [i][[Dunkerque (Azur Lane)|]][/i] and [i][[Richelieu (Azur Lane)|]][/i] classes. Her character is based on the "26 500 battlecruiser project" (reclassed in [i]Azur Lane[/i] as [i]large cruiser[/i]), which was bascally 90% finished [i][[Dunkerque (Azur Lane)|]][/i] design, changed a bit by Wargaming for "balans" reasons. Said design was evolution of 23 333t. battlecruiser design that French navy saw as basis of its future fleet of the line. The number 23 333t was very important as it allowed France to build 3 ships and fit into special 70 000t. allowed under Washington Naval Treaty. Plans had to be abandoned as protection of 23k design was designed based on 203mm of [i][[Zara (Azur Lane)|]][/i] class and as such was an inadequate defense against newly announced 283mm of  [i][[Deutschland (Azur Lane)|]][/i] class, leading to uparmored, uparmed design of 26 500t. and eventually to [i][[Dunkerque (Azur Lane)|]][/i]. 

Caution must be taken with the use of her name since it uses a nasal R sound instead of a hard R (which is prone for breast jokes despite actually being portrayed with [[large breasts]]). Otherwise her physical attributes include [[long hair|long]] [[blonde hair]] and [[blue eyes]].

Her default outfit consists of a [[white leotard]] and [[white dress]], [[white panties|white]] [[highleg panties]], and [[high heels]]. Her [[rigging]] consists of her two 330 mm quad mounts, one per side, and four 139 mm twin mounts, all mounted on low rigs as she also has [[multiple wings|six large]] [[yellow wings]] and a familiar to her back.

h4. Skins
* !post #6023863: Default

title: el_chavo_del_ocho
body: [b]El Chavo del Ocho[/b] ("The Kid From The Eight"), often shortened to simply [[El Chavo]] ([i]"The Kid"[/i]), is a classic, very light hearted and very popular comedy sitcom that originally aired on Televisa network, in [[Mexico]], from 1973 to 1980. It also gained enormous popularity in Latin America as well as in [[Brazil]] (known there as [i]"Chaves"[/i]), [[Spain]] and other countries in addition to the Spanish-speaking portion of the [[United States]]. El Chavo was created by comedian "Roberto Gómez Bolaños, a.k.a. Chespirito":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Chespirito , who also played the main character. h4. Characters * [[El Chavo]] * [[Don Ramon]] ** [[Chilindrina]] * [[Dona Florinda]] ** [[Quico]] * [[Senor Barriga]] ** [[Nono (el chavo del ocho)|]] * [[Popis]] * [[Profesor Jirafales]] * [[Paty (el chavo del ocho)|]] * [[Godinez]] * [[Jaimito El Cartero]] * [[Dona Clotilde|La Bruja del 71]] h4. title: bolo_tie
body:
A thin cord or braided strap, fed through a decorative clasp and secured around the neck in place of a necktie. Commonly associated in the US with Texas and other Western US fashion. Also known as a spaghetti tie.  

Not to be confused with [[cross tie]]s, which are made out of a wider strap of fabric and commonly shorter than bolo ties; nor [[neck ribbon]]s, which rather than being held together with a clasp are simply tied in a bow.

title: ian_mckellen
body:
Sir Ian Murray McKellen CH CBE (born 25 May 1939) is an English actor. With a career spanning more than sixty years, he is noted for his roles on the screen and stage in genres ranging from Shakespearean dramas and modern theatre to popular fantasy and science fiction.

McKellen achieved worldwide fame for his film roles, including the titular King in Richard III (1995), [[Magneto]] in the [[x-men film series|X-Men films]], and [[Gandalf]] in [[The Lord of the Rings]] (2001–2003) and [[The Hobbit]] (2012–2014) trilogies. 
McKellen came out as gay in 1988, and has since championed [[LGBT pride|LGBT]] social movements worldwide.

title: william_shatner
body: William Shatner (born March 22, 1931) is a Canadian actor. In a career spanning seven decades, he is best known for his portrayal of [[James Tiberius Kirk]] in the [[Star Trek]] franchise, from his 1966 debut as the captain of the starship Enterprise in the second pilot of the first Star Trek television series to his final appearance as Captain Kirk in the seventh Star Trek feature film, [[Star Trek: Generations]] (1994).
other_names: ウィリアム・シャトナー

title: star_trek:_first_contact
body: Star Trek: First Contact is a 1996 American science fiction film directed by Jonathan Frakes in his feature film debut. It is the eighth movie of the [[Star Trek]] franchise, and the second starring the cast of the television series [[Star Trek: The Next Generation]]. In the film, the crew of the starship USS Enterprise-E travel back in time from the 24th century to the 21st century to stop the cybernetic Borg from conquering Earth by changing the past.

title: el_chavo_animado
body: El Chavo Animado (El Chavo: The Animated Series in English) is a Mexican animated series based on the live action television series [[El Chavo del Ocho]], created by Roberto Gómez Bolaños, produced by Televisa and Ánima Estudios. It aired on Canal 5, and repeats were also shown on Las Estrellas and [[Cartoon Network]] Latin America. 135 episodes aired between 2006 and 2014.

Sometimes, they can [[object in obi|tucked]] in the [[obi]] instead. The purse that holds the futokorogatana is usually tied with [[flower knot]].

title: bride
body:
A woman (or a cross-dressing man) getting married in a [[wedding]] ceremony. Although different cultures have different wedding styles, usually a bride for a western wedding is portrayed on Danbooru with a long [[white dress]] (or a color of the bride's choosing), a [[veil]] and a [[bouquet]] of [[flower]]s.

h4. Traditional Japanese bridalwear

h5. Outfit
* [[kimono]]
* [[shiromuku]]
* [[uchikake]]

h5. Headwear
* [[tsunokakushi]]
* [[wataboushi]]

h5. Accessories
Accessory items are usually [[object in obi|tucked into]] the bridal [[kimono]]'s [[obi]] or in futokoro, the space within the front of kimono collar and above the obi.
* [[Futokorogatana]] (懐刀): Translating as "chest sword", a small [[dagger]] held in a small, decorative brocade-fabric purse tucked into the collar of a woman's wedding kimono. Similar to a kaiken. ("Wikipedia":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/List_of_items_traditionally_worn_in_Japan#F)
* [[Hakoseko]] (筥迫): A decorated [[wallet]] ("Wikitionary":https://en.wiktionary.org/wiki/%E3%81%AF%E3%81%93%E3%81%9B%E3%81%93#Japanese)
* Kaiken (懐剣): A small [[dagger]] ("Wikipedia":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Kaiken_(dagger))
* Sensu (扇子): A [[folding fan]]

h5. Examples

h4. See also

* [[Uchikake]]

As [[bride|bridalwear]] in a traditional Japanese [[wedding]], they usually come in a set with a [[hakoseko]] and a [[futokorogatana]].

title: railing
body:
A short permanent barrier with a handrail used for control or safety purposes for people (along walkways, bridges, [[stairs|stairways]], balconies, the ends of train cars, etc).

h4. See also

* [[banister]]
* [[barricade]]
* [[guard rail]]
* [[stanchion]]
* [[on railing]]
* [[railroad tracks]]

title: stairs
body:
A device composed of elevated stationary platforms that takes a person or object from one place to another, either higher or lower.

h4. See also

* [[On stairs]]
* [[Banister]]
* [[Escalator]]
* [[Elevator]]
* [[Railing]]
* [[Handrail]]

title: banister
body: A [[handrail]] and supporting posts (balusters) for a set of [[stairs]]. Effectively a specialized form of [[railing]] specifically for unenclosed staircases, and may be found on one or both sides of the staircase. May also adjoin a regular railing at the top of the stairs.

title: see-through_sarong
body: A [[sarong]] that is [[see-through clothes|see-through]].

title: see-through_shawl
body: A [[shawl]] that is made of transparent material.

title: tana_(fire_emblem)
body: Tana is a playable character in [[Fire Emblem: The Sacred Stones]]. She is the princess of Frelia, and the younger sister of [[Innes (fire emblem)|]]. She is a pegasus rider, and old friend of [[Eirika (fire emblem)|]] and [[Ephraim (fire emblem)|]].

title: maeryll_(alexis_flower)
body: Maeryll is a female OC created by [[Alexis Flower]] for their [[I Roved Out In Search of Truth and Love]] webcomic/setting. A former assassin and current elven anti-mage, she is best friends with the other main character of the story, [[cinder_(alexis_flower)|Cinder]], and a crush on the human plainswalker Naga. Unlike her bisexual bestie, Maeryll is a lesbian, but has nearly as voracious an appetite for sexual exploits.

title: yugiri_(strinova)
body: Character from [[Strinova]].

title: cinder_(alexis_flower)
body: Cinderella von Umberwolf is a female OC created by [[Alexis Flower]] for their [[I Roved Out In Search of Truth and Love]] webcomic/setting. An elven ranger who mostly goes by 'Cinder', she is best friends with the other main character of the story, [[maeryll_(alexis_flower)|Maeryll]], and together they fuck their way through a wide array of fantastic locations and scenarios.

title: i_roved_out_in_search_of_truth_and_love
body:
Webcomic created by [[Alexis Flower]] and starring a pair of elves named [[cinder_(alexis_flower)|Cinder]] and [[maeryll_(alexis_flower)|Maeryll]]. Heavily pornographic and yet just as heavily plot-driven with deep lore for anyone who can pay attention to more than Cinder's giant boobs and the litany of men and women she sleeps with during her epic quest to not get shanked by assassins from The Harlots Guild.

h4. Characters

title: hololive_summer_2022_swimsuit
body:
The [[official alternate costume|official]] swimsuit worn by [[hololive]] members during the hololive Summer 2022 event. 

Unlike the original 2019 hololive Summer program, where each member got a personalized swimsuit as a new outfit, this time all members got a color-coded variation of the same swimsuit: a [[white bikini|white]] [[frilled bikini|frilled]] [[print bikini]] with four patterns on it (sparkle, heart, the [[hololive Alternative]] logo, and the standard hololive logo), plus a [[white skirt|white]] [[frilled skirt|frilled]] [[bikini skirt|bikini]] [[miniskirt]] with the same patterns.

Note that this applies only to hololive's Japanese talents, as the overseas talents that had 3D models (comprising [[Area 15]] and [[holoMyth]]) never received them, with Japan only reopening its borders fully in October 2022, months after the summer program. As such, artworks featuring the overseas talents use [[design speculation|speculative designs]].

h4. Appearance

* !post #5671355

h4. See also

* [[hololive summer 2023 swimsuit]]
* [[List of hololive official costumes]]

Despite the name, the tag refers to socks that are slightly above the ankles, not the extremely short ones that stop exactly at or below the ankles. They end before the shins, if they go over the shins, they become [[kneehighs]].

Not to be confused with [[bootie]]s, a sock-like garment that is also ankle length.

title: calne_ca_(deino)
body:
(Karune Shiie, Calne Ca) 
[[Deino (deino3330)|]]'s [[original]] character. 
Her name is a pun of "Ca (calcium)." 

She has one red mechanical eye on the left, and both of her legs are twisted metal. Her right arm is made of the same twisted metal, her left is elongated bone starting just below the shoulder. And, most notably, metal finger-like protrusions sit under her face in place of a bottom jaw. She sometimes has an [[isopod]] in her hair which she calls "[[Nato-kun]]".
The amount of mechanical parts may vary depending on the illustration. In some images, she is completely humanoid. 
Her true form is a mechanical skeleton called "Ca (calcium)."

A variation of her with more insectoid features appears in the video [[Saikin Osen - Bacterial Contamination - (vocaloid)|]].

She often cosplays [[Hatsune Miku]] and appears in [[Vocaloid]] videos, but should not be confused for a Vocaloid character.

h6.Machine Muzik 

* NicoNico video: http://www.nicovideo.jp/watch/sm7517638 
* Youtube video: http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=PRd7gOfIS-0 

h6.Ca's character details on Piapro 

* [1]: http://piapro.jp/content/ys6oc865j5if29r5

title: matoi_ryuuko
body:
The main character of [[Kill La Kill]].

She has [[short_hair|short]], [[streaked hair|streaked]], [[black hair]] with a [[red_hair|red]] highlight. Her weapon is a [[scissor blade (kill la kill)|]], half of a pair of scissors.

She is generally seen wearing [[Senketsu]], which can change form. While in a normal state, Senketsu is essentially a [[serafuku]]. The top is somewhat short, with [[suspenders]] between it and the [[pleated skirt]]. Ryuuko's [[midriff]] and [[navel]] are shown.

While in a transformed state, Senketsu changes dramatically. The top and skirt get dramatically [[microskirt|shorter]], [[revealing clothes|exposing]] Ryuuko's [[underboob]]. Somehow, Ryuuko also winds up wearing [[thigh boots]].

[[Matoi Ryuuko]]'s [[sukajan]] is rather well known and has "its' own tag on pixiv":[http://dic.pixiv.net/a/%E3%82%B9%E3%82%AB%E3%82%B8%E3%83%A3%E3%83%B3%E6%B5%81%E5%AD%90] despite only making brief appearances in the first and last episode of the anime due to her swearing it off in favor of wearing Senketsu.

She is voiced by [[Koshimizu Ami]] in Japanese and [[Erica Mendez]] in English.

h4. See also
* [[Grill la Grill (meme)|]]
* [[My Little Pogchamp (meme)|]]
* [[Ryuko Redraw (meme)|]]

title: saigyouji_yuyuko
body:
The "Ghost of Flawless Immaculate Beauty". Final boss of [[Touhou]]'s [i][[Perfect Cherry Blossom]][/i] and later a recurring playable character in the earlier fighting games.

"Princess" of [[Hakugyokurou]], the netherworld pagoda, whose power to invoke death drove her to suicide when she was human, only to end up in [[Gensokyo]] without any memory of her past. 

Despite her tragic history, she often acts as a rather ditzy airhead, seemingly thinking of nothing but anticipating her meals, sleeping, and teasing her straight-laced bodyguard and gardener, [[Konpaku Youmu]]. All these facets, however, conceal an incredibly sharp mind to rival that of her closest friend, [[Yakumo Yukari]].

Depictions might show her with the cherry tree her body was buried under, the [[Saigyou Ayakashi]].

Non-ghost depictions of her can be found under [[Saigyouji Yuyuko (living)]]. 

h4. See also

* [[Saigyouji Yuyuko's fan design]]

h4. External links

* "Touhou Wiki: Yuyuko Saigyouji":[http://en.touhouwiki.net/wiki/Yuyuko_Saigyouji]

title: littorio_(azur_lane)
body:
[[azur_lane|Azur Lane's]] personification of the battleship [i]Littorio[/i]. Character design by [[Gujianshaonu]], voiced by [[Itou Shizuka]].

She has [[green hair]], [[red eyes]], and [[large breasts]]. She is sometimes seen holding a [[rose]] as well.

The leader of the Sardegnia Empire, Littorio displays an exceptionally confident and outright arrogant personality, believing it her mission to spread her light to the world, in addition to [[yuri|seducing every ship she can]] ([i]especially[/i] [[Illustrious_(azur_lane)|]]). However, Littorio’s flirtatious behavior is simply part of her character trait as the “womanizer” of the Italian ships, not an indication of genuine romantic or sexual attraction to other shipgirls. Her interactions are meant to be playful teasing rather than serious romantic advances. In port, she seeks to help the [[Commander (Azur Lane)|]] better themselves, but can prove to be quite pushy.

h4. Appearance

title: slave
body:
A human being or its fictional equivalent that is owned and controlled by a "master". A slave is typically used for forced labor and they obey their master's commands, lest they suffer punishment.

Use this tag when a character is seen depicted or treated as a slave. Often seen with their hands [[chained]], having an [[animal collar]] with leash on the neck, or wearing [[rags]].

If the tone is especially sexual, consider using [[femdom]] or [[assertive female]].

title: raven_(path_to_nowhere)
body:
A playable character from [[Path to Nowhere]], a central story character from chapter 11 onwards. Voiced by [[Kaida Yuuko]].

An S rank Sinner, known by her pen name 'Raven', she is a journalist, writer, poet, teacher, and a social media account manager, otherwise known as her real name <spoiler>Raye</spoiler>. She is usually seen with [[crow]]s made up of the black ink she manipulates. Her alignment is Fraud.

Raven has [[very long hair|very long]] [[curly hair|curly]] darkish [[green hair]] with [[green eyes]], she has a large scar on her head stretching down her right eye ([[scar on forehead]] + [[scar across eye]]), as well as a large [[scar on back|scar on her back]]. Wears [[purple eyeliner]] and [[purple lips|purple lipstick]] make ups, has a [[mole above eye|mole above her left eye]] and usually depicted with [[sharp teeth]].

Her outfit has a [[backless shirt|backless]] [[white shirt]] with [[pelvic curtain]], [[black leggings]] with [[black footwear|black]] [[high heel boots]], wears a [[black gloves|black]] [[single elbow glove]] on her left arm, and a metallic [[falconry glove]] on the right. As well as a [[purple shawl]] and a [[black bowtie]].

h4. Appearance

title: weser_(azur_lane)
body:
[[Azur Lane]]'s personification of the German light aircraft carrier [i]Weser[/i]. 
Character design by [[Haori Io]].

In-game, she is portrayed with [[short hair|short]] [[red hair]] and [[red eyes]]. Her outfit consists of a white [[military uniform]] with an [[Iron Cross]] medal on her left, a two-tone cape (red inner, black outer), [[necktie]], [[black belt]], black [[thighhighs]], and black [[high heels|high-heeled]] [[thigh boots]]. Her short red hair leads many players to make references to [[Exusiai (Arknights)|]].

Her rig is identical to the [i]Essex[/i]-class with a split-[[flight deck]] arrangement, but bearing Ironblood animal styles.

h4. Skins
* !post #4290540: Default
* !post #5020219:  [[weser (obsidian elegance) (azur lane)|Obsidian Elegance]]

* !post #5615153:  [[weser (wave-washed paradise) (azur lane)|Wave-washed Paradise]]
* !post #8465458:  [[weser (offtime cafe) (azur lane)|Off-time Cafe]]

h4. History
She was originally laid down and constructed as [i]Seydlitz[/i], the fourth [[Admiral Hipper (Azur Lane)|]]-class heavy cruiser (not to be confused with the earlier SMS [i][[Seydlitz (Azur Lane)|]][/i]), but her completion as a heavy cruiser was cancelled in 1940 when she was almost complete to convert her to a light aircraft carrier.

Her conversion was stalled in 1943 and never resumed, ultimately being scuttled in 1945. The Soviets considered reusing some of her parts for [[Tallinn (Azur Lane)|]], but no work was ever done besides scrapping.

h4. Related Characters

h5. Admiral Hipper-class Heavy Cruisers

title: parted_grey_nun_(diva)
body:
A former member of main convent, currently residing in city monastery.

Although a few early strips (post #4294740 and post #4303592, specifically) feature her as a member of the main convent alongside the current youngest generation of nuns (i.e [[Clumsy Nun (diva)|]], [[Hungry Nun (diva)|]] etc.), later canon establishes, that she had already left the convent by the time any of them joined.

title: wakatsuki_(azur_lane)
body:
[i][[Azur Lane]][/i]'s personification of the Japanese destroyer [i]Wakatsuki[/i]. Character designed by [[Nishikikope]]. 

h4. Appearance

She is portrayed with [[long hair|long]] [[blue hair]] with a prominent [[white hairband]], and [[blue eyes]]. Her default outfit consists of a [[sleeveless]] white [[kimono]] top, white [[hakama]] skirt, [[long sleeves|a long-sleeved]] [[haori]] that resembles the [[Shinsengumi]]'s blue-and-white mountaintop pattern, white [[kneehighs]], and blue [[sandals]] with attached hull pieces. 

Her [[rigging]] consists of a 10 cm twin [[anti-aircraft gun|DP gun mount]] on her right and 610 mm quad [[torpedo tubes]] to her left, held together by a rig to her back that contains her [[depth charge]]s and [[searchlight]], with blue [[wings]].

h4. History
She was commissioned on 31 May 1943, and was sunk by US carrier aircraft alongside [[Naganami (Azur Lane)|]] and [[Shimakaze (Azur Lane)|]] in a convoy run in the Philippines on 11 November 1944.

title: volga_(azur_lane)
body:
[[Azur Lane]]'s personification of what would have been the Soviet Navy's definitive WWII aircraft carrier design, Project 72.

h4. History
While Project 72/[i]Volga[/i] wasn't the first CV project the Soviets considered, she was born out of changing Soviet naval planning and developments in carrier operations by the US, UK, and Japanese navies as the war progressed.

Project 72 was designed in 1944 as a 30,000 ton carrier that took inspiration from [[Illustrious (Azur Lane)|]] capable of carrying 60+ aircraft, but progress was slow since priorities went to the ongoing fight on the Eastern Front towards Berlin. In any case, post-war shipbuilding priority went to submarines, cruisers (like the unfinished [[Chapayev (Azur Lane)|]]), and destroyers, and larger ship types were given less consideration.

h4. Skins
* !post #6004371: Default
* !post #5165035:  [[volga (an irresistible ar adventure) (azur lane)|An Irresistible AR Adventure]]

h4. External links
* "All Soviet Navy CV Projects, including [i]Project 72[/i]":[https://weaponsandwarfare.com/2020/07/26/soviet-navy-wwii-aircraft-carrier-design/]

title: vincenzo_gioberti_(azur_lane)
body:
[[Azur Lane]]'s personification of the Italian destroyer [i]Vincenzo Gioberti[/i]. Character design by [[Dango Remi]], voiced by Yoshioka Misaki.

h4. Appearance

In-game, she has [[purple eyes]] and [[long hair|long]] [[grey hair]] tied in [[twintails]] (or [[two side up]]) with a [[sailor hat]] emblazoned with an [[anchor symbol]]. She wears a [[green capelet]] with [[epaulettes]] over a buttoned [[two-tone dress]]. Unlike [[Alfredo Oriani (Azur Lane)|her sister]], she doesn't have her real-life hull letters (GB) on the dress.

Her rig is similar to [[Carabiniere (Azur Lane)|]] in that her 533 mm triple [[torpedo tubes]] is to her left and her 120 mm twin gun mount is to her right, but her rig carries them directly attached to the hull parts that display the distinctive red-white stripe pattern found on [[Regia Marina]] ships prior to 1943.

h4. History
In real life, [i]Vincenzo Gioberti[/i] was the second [i]Oriani[/i]-class destroyer built, commissioned in 1937. The class was grouped together as the 9th Destroyer Division and served in the battles of Calabria and Cape Matapan and was damaged in the latter engagement where two of her sisters were sunk by [[Royal Navy]] battleships [[Valiant (Azur Lane)|]] and [[Warspite (Azur Lane)|]] in a night battle.

After Matapan, she received an anti-air refit that saw her lose one of her torpedo mounts. This did not save her from being sunk by a Royal Navy submarine in August 1943, just a month before the armistice.

title: ulrich_von_hutten_(azur_lane)
body:
[[Azur Lane]]'s personification of the German battleship [i]Ulrich von Hutten[/i]. Character design by [[Ohisashiburi]], voiced by [[Yamamura Hibiku (voice Actor)|]]. 

She is a personification of one of the H-39 proposals, much like [[Friedrich der Grosse (azur lane)|]], though she seems to have more of a "younger sister" look. She has [[black hair]] with [[yellow eyes]] with a pair of red [[horns]]. Her legs are clad in [[black thighhighs]] while she appears to be wearing a black [[jacket]]. Her [[rigging]], much like other experimental Ironblood capital ships, is massive and has a deeply animalistic aesthetic. She also exhibits a cynical personality compared to the more nurturing Friedrich.

title: vestal_(azur_lane)
body:
The personification of the repair ship USS [i]Vestal[/i] (AR-4) in [i][[Azur Lane]][/i]. Character designed by [[Saru]], voiced by Maia.

She is portrayed with [[blue eyes]] and [[light purple hair]], a small [[single braid]] on her left side, and [[bangs]]. She wears a modified [[nun]] outfit with a [[nurse cap]], [[white legwear|white]] [[thighhighs]] and [[garter straps]]. She has several cloth, white crosses attached to her outfit, notably under her long [[overskirt]]. Her sleeves are split along the front, leading up to [[puffy short sleeves]]. Her robes, sleeves, and hat each have pink lining on the inside. Vestal also wears [[rei_no_himo|"that ribbon"]], tidying up her sleeves and supporting her breasts.

body:
[[Azur Lane]]'s personification of the German submarine U-96. Character designed by [[Kinjo Kuromomo]]. 

Known as the submarine featured in the book [b]Das Boot[/b], later adapted in 1981 into a Wolfgang Petersen film. Both are taken from war journalist Lothar Günther-Buchheim's personal experiences from when he was assigned to U-96 in autumn 1941.
